00002  * @file ccn_keystore.c

00020 #include <stdio.h>
00021 #include <stdlib.h>
00022 #include <string.h>
00023 #include <ctype.h>
00024 #include <openssl/bn.h>
00025 #include <openssl/rsa.h>
00026 #include <openssl/evp.h>
00027 #include <openssl/x509v3.h>
00028 #include <openssl/pkcs12.h>
00029 #include <openssl/sha.h>
00030 #include <openssl/rand.h>
00031 
00032 #include <ccn/keystore.h>
00033 
00034 struct ccn_keystore {
00035     int initialized;
00036     EVP_PKEY *private_key;
00037     EVP_PKEY *public_key;
00038     X509 *certificate;
00039     ssize_t pubkey_digest_length;
00040     unsigned char pubkey_digest[SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH];
00041 };
00042 
00043 struct ccn_keystore *
00044 ccn_keystore_create(void)
00045 {
00046     struct ccn_keystore *res = calloc(1, sizeof(*res));
00047     return (res);
00048 }
00049 
00050 void
00051 ccn_keystore_destroy(struct ccn_keystore **p)
00052 {
00053     if (*p != NULL) {
00054         if ((*p)->private_key != NULL)
00055             EVP_PKEY_free((*p)->private_key);
00056         if ((*p)->public_key != NULL)
00057             EVP_PKEY_free((*p)->public_key);
00058         if ((*p)->certificate != NULL)
00059             X509_free((*p)->certificate);
00060         free(*p);
00061         *p = NULL;
00062     }
00063 }
00064 
00065 int
00066 ccn_keystore_init(struct ccn_keystore *p, char *filename, char *password)
00067 {
00068     FILE *fp;
00069     PKCS12 *keystore;
00070     int res;
00071 
00072     OpenSSL_add_all_algorithms();
00073     fp = fopen(filename, "rb");
00074     if (fp == NULL)
00075         return (-1);
00076 
00077     keystore = d2i_PKCS12_fp(fp, NULL);
00078     fclose(fp);
00079     if (keystore == NULL)
00080         return (-1);
00081 
00082     res = PKCS12_parse(keystore, password, &(p->private_key), &(p->certificate), NULL);
00083     PKCS12_free(keystore);
00084     if (res == 0) {
00085         return (-1);
00086     }
00087     p->public_key = X509_get_pubkey(p->certificate);
00088     /* cache the public key digest to avoid work later */
00089     if (1 != ASN1_item_digest(ASN1_ITEM_rptr(X509_PUBKEY), EVP_sha256(),
00090                               X509_get_X509_PUBKEY(p->certificate),
00091                               p->pubkey_digest, NULL)) return (-1);
00092     p->pubkey_digest_length = SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH;
00093     p->initialized = 1;
00094     return (0);
00095 }
00096 
00097 const struct ccn_pkey *
00098 ccn_keystore_private_key(struct ccn_keystore *p)
00099 {
00100     if (0 == p->initialized)
00101         return (NULL);
00102 
00103     return ((const struct ccn_pkey *)(p->private_key));
00104 }
00105 
00106 const struct ccn_pkey *
00107 ccn_keystore_public_key(struct ccn_keystore *p)
00108 {
00109     if (0 == p->initialized)
00110         return (NULL);
00111 
00112     return ((const struct ccn_pkey *)(p->public_key));
00113 }
00114 
00115 ssize_t
00116 ccn_keystore_public_key_digest_length(struct ccn_keystore *p)
00117 {
00118     return ((0 == p->initialized) ? -1 : p->pubkey_digest_length);
00119 }
00120 
00121 const unsigned char *
00122 ccn_keystore_public_key_digest(struct ccn_keystore *p)
00123 {
00124     if (0 == p->initialized)
00125         return (NULL);
00126     return (p->pubkey_digest);
00127 }
00128 
00129 const struct ccn_certificate *
00130 ccn_keystore_certificate(struct ccn_keystore *p)
00131 {
00132     if (0 == p->initialized)
00133         return (NULL);
00134 
00135     return ((const void *)(p->certificate));
00136 }
00137 
00138 static int
00139 add_cert_extension_with_context(X509 *cert, int nid, char *value)
00140 {
00141     X509_EXTENSION *extension;
00142     X509V3_CTX context;
00143     
00144     X509V3_set_ctx_nodb(&context);
00145     X509V3_set_ctx(&context, cert, cert, NULL, NULL, 0);
00146     extension = X509V3_EXT_conf_nid(NULL, &context, nid, value);
00147     if (extension == NULL)
00148         return(0);
00149     X509_add_ext(cert, extension, -1);
00150     X509_EXTENSION_free(extension);
00151     return(1);
00152 }
00153 
00154 static int
00155 add_cert_extension(X509 *cert, int nid, char *value)
00156 {
00157     X509_EXTENSION *extension;
00158     extension = X509V3_EXT_conf_nid(NULL, NULL, nid, value);
00159     if (extension == NULL)
00160         return(0);
00161     X509_add_ext(cert, extension, -1);
00162     X509_EXTENSION_free(extension);
00163     return(1);
00164 }
00165 /**
00166  * Create a PKCS12 keystore file
00167  * @param filename  the name of the keystore file to be created.
00168  * @param password  the import/export password for the keystore.
00169  * @param subject   the subject (and issuer) name in the certificate.
00170                     A lowercase version of the subject name will be used for the
00171                     "friendly name" (alias) associated with the private key.
00172  * @param keylength the number of bits in the RSA key to be generated.
00173  *                  A value <= 0 will result in the default (1024) being used.
00174  * @param validity_days the number of days the certificate in the keystore will
00175  *                  be valid.  A value <= 0 will result in the default (30) being used.
00176  * @returns 0 on success, -1 on failure
00177  */
00178 int
00179 ccn_keystore_file_init(char *filename, char *password,
00180                        char *subject, int keylength, int validity_days)
00181 {
00182         RSA *rsa = RSA_new();
00183     BIGNUM *pub_exp = BN_new();
00184     EVP_PKEY *pkey = EVP_PKEY_new();
00185     X509 *cert = X509_new();
00186     X509_NAME *name = NULL;
00187     PKCS12 *pkcs12 = NULL;
00188     unsigned char spkid[SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH];
00189     char spkid_hex[1 + 2 * SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH];
00190     unsigned long serial = 0;
00191     unsigned char serial_bytes[sizeof(serial)];
00192     char *friendly_name = NULL;
00193     FILE *fp = NULL;
00194     int res;
00195     int i;
00196     int ans = -1;
00197     
00198     // Check whether initial allocations succeeded.
00199     if (rsa == NULL || pub_exp == NULL || pkey == NULL || cert == NULL)
00200         goto Bail;
00201     
00202     // Set up default values for keylength and expiration.
00203     if (keylength <= 0)
00204         keylength = 1024;
00205     if (validity_days <= 0)
00206         validity_days = 30;
00207     
00208     OpenSSL_add_all_algorithms();
00209     
00210     BN_set_word(pub_exp, RSA_F4);
00211     res = 1;
00212     res &= RSA_generate_key_ex(rsa, keylength, pub_exp, NULL);
00213     res &= EVP_PKEY_set1_RSA(pkey, rsa);
00214     res &= X509_set_version(cert, 2);       // 2 => X509v3
00215         if (res == 0)
00216         goto Bail;
00217     
00218     // Construct random positive serial number.
00219     RAND_bytes(serial_bytes, sizeof(serial_bytes));
00220     serial_bytes[0] &= 0x7F;
00221     serial = 0;
00222     for (i=0; i < sizeof(serial_bytes); i++) {
00223         serial = (256 * serial) + serial_bytes[i];
00224     }
00225         ASN1_INTEGER_set(X509_get_serialNumber(cert), serial);
00226     
00227     // Set the validity from now for the specified number of days.
00228     X509_gmtime_adj(X509_get_notBefore(cert), (long)0);
00229     X509_gmtime_adj(X509_get_notAfter(cert), (long)(60 * 60 * 24 * validity_days));
00230     X509_set_pubkey(cert, pkey);
00231     
00232     // Set up the simple subject name for the certificate.
00233     name = X509_get_subject_name(cert);
00234     if (name == NULL)
00235         goto Bail;
00236     res = X509_NAME_add_entry_by_txt(name, "CN", MBSTRING_ASC, (unsigned char *)subject, -1, -1, 0);
00237         res &= X509_set_issuer_name(cert, name);
00238     
00239     // Add the necessary extensions.
00240     res &= add_cert_extension(cert, NID_basic_constraints, "critical,CA:FALSE");
00241     res &= add_cert_extension(cert, NID_key_usage, "digitalSignature,nonRepudiation,keyEncipherment,dataEncipherment,keyAgreement");
00242     res &= add_cert_extension(cert, NID_ext_key_usage, "clientAuth");
00243     
00244     if (res == 0)
00245         goto Bail;
00246     
00247     /* Generate a KeyID which is the SHA256 digest of the DER encoding
00248          * of a SubjectPublicKeyInfo.  Note that this is slightly uncommon,
00249          * but it is more general and complete than digesting the BIT STRING
00250          * component of the SubjectPublicKeyInfo itself (and no standard dictates
00251          * how you must generate a key ID).  This code must produce the same result
00252      * as the Java version applied to the same SubjectPublicKeyInfo.
00253      */
00254     
00255     res = ASN1_item_digest(ASN1_ITEM_rptr(X509_PUBKEY), EVP_sha256(),
00256                            X509_get_X509_PUBKEY(cert),
00257                            spkid, NULL);
00258     
00259     for (i = 0; i < 32; i++) snprintf(&spkid_hex[2 * i], 3, "%02X", (unsigned)spkid[i]);
00260     res &= add_cert_extension(cert, NID_subject_key_identifier, spkid_hex);
00261     res &= add_cert_extension_with_context(cert, NID_authority_key_identifier, "keyid:always");
00262     if (res == 0)
00263         goto Bail;
00264     
00265     // The certificate is complete, sign it.
00266     res = X509_sign(cert, pkey, EVP_sha1());
00267     if (res == 0)
00268         goto Bail;
00269 
00270     // Construct the friendly name as lowercase of subject name
00271     friendly_name = strdup(subject);
00272     for (i = 0; i < strlen(friendly_name); i++){
00273         int c = friendly_name[i];
00274         if (isupper(c))
00275             friendly_name[i] = tolower(c);
00276     }
00277     // construct the full PKCS12 keystore to hold the certificate and private key
00278     pkcs12 = PKCS12_create(password,  friendly_name, pkey, cert, NULL, 0, 0,
00279                            1024 /*iter*/, 1024 /*mac_iter*/, 0);
00280     if (pkcs12 == NULL)
00281         goto Bail;
00282     
00283     fp = fopen(filename, "wb");
00284     if (fp == NULL)
00285         goto Bail;
00286     i2d_PKCS12_fp(fp, pkcs12);
00287     fclose(fp);
00288     
00289     ans = 0;
00290     
00291     // For debugging, the following may be helpful:
00292     // RSA_print_fp(stderr, pkey->pkey.rsa, 0); */
00293     // X509_print_fp(stderr, cert);
00294         // PEM_write_PrivateKey(stderr, pkey, NULL, NULL, 0, NULL, NULL); */
00295         // PEM_write_X509(stderr, cert);
00296     
00297     
00298 Bail:
00299     
00300     if (friendly_name != NULL) {
00301         free(friendly_name);
00302         friendly_name = NULL;
00303     }
00304     if (pkey != NULL) {
00305         EVP_PKEY_free(pkey);
00306         pkey = NULL;
00307     }
00308     if (rsa != NULL) {
00309         RSA_free(rsa);
00310         rsa = NULL;
00311     }
00312     if (pub_exp != NULL){
00313         BN_free(pub_exp);
00314         pub_exp = NULL;
00315     }
00316     if (cert != NULL) {
00317         X509_free(cert);
00318         cert = NULL;
00319     }
00320     if (pkcs12 != NULL) {
00321         PKCS12_free(pkcs12);
00322         pkcs12 = NULL;
00323     }
00324     return (ans);
00325 }
